content: this pattern is just an extension to the dandelion dreamers soaker pattern you will need that pattern to make the skort if you do not have version b1 of the soaker pattern please email me at patti@dandeliondreamers com dandelion dreamers skooter skort version a2 january 7 2007 please check your gauge before starting body make the body of the soaker the same as in the dandelion dreamers soaker pattern note changes as follows round 1 ch1 then work in back loops only of beg chain and follow as stated in soaker pattern round 2 working through both loops work round 2 same as soaker pattern work the remainder of the soaker body as in the soaker pattern pleated skirt this pattern was created using -worsted weight wool 4 5 7 8 9 oz this includes the amount needed for the entire project -sport weight wool optional -i hook -j hook optional gauge 4 sts per inch in single_crochet 4 row per inch 3 5 sts per inch in double_crochet 2 row per inch not as important for the skirt *the pleated skooter skort pictured was made with worsted weight yarn if you would like a lighter weight skirt use the optional materials listed above and crochet loosely copyright © 2005 by patti gonsalves at dandelions2@yahoo com or http \\www dandeliondreamers com for further information page 1 of 1 with i hook and wrong-side facing join worsted weight yarn with slip_stitch working in the front loops only at the waist of the soaker as shown in the picture if you want to make a lighter weight skirt use the sport weight yarn and a j hook round 1 ch3 counts as first double_crochet now and throughout double_crochet in front loops of each st around join w/ slip_stitch in top of chain 3 54 60 72 80 88 double_crochet round 2 for - pr & nb/sm chain 3 double_crochet in next 4 double_crochet 3 fpdc in next double_crochet makes fpdc group double_crochet in next 5 double_crochet 3 fpdc in next double_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch to top of chain 3 72 80 sts round 2 for med large & xl chain 3 double_crochet in next 6 double_crochet 3 fpdc in next double_crochet makes fpdc group double_crochet in next 7 double_crochet 3 fpdc in next double_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch to top of chain 3 90 100 110 sts round 3 chain 3 double_crochet in ea double_crochet and fpdc 2 fpdc in next st fpdc in each fpdc group around join w/ slip_stitch in top of chain 3 81 90 99 110 121 sts round 4 chain 3 double_crochet in next
